WRITING.TITLE: Xbox One Download Speeds?
WRITING.TEXT: hi, i was wondering if anyone could help?! i run a detailed network statistic and get results along the lines of this picture below: 71mbps download and 17mbps upload speeds. yet when it comes to actually downloading updates the for the xbox, i'm only getting small number speeds, some even as low as 300kbps?! can you explain why and how i can fix this? i've got pictures but i can't include them for some reason... pls help!
makes sense, that is what i'm currently downloading as well!
so all my games will be playable from day one then? all my current games i can play now on my xbox x?
Does anyone think that xbox parties will be cross platform? like would i be able to join parties with my pals that have xbox one, if i have series x?
maybe that could be integrated within the parental controls? anyone over the required age could then opt in or out via their settings
suppose so! it wouldn't be something i would invest in, just think it would be a fun feature to add if they found a way around the legalities of it all
game is included, will all dlc i think

WRITING.TITLE: KH3 Pause Menu Bug??
WRITING.TEXT: Never played KH games when i was young, so i've played through them all within the past few months and finally got onto KH3 a few days ago, played through up until Kingdom of Corona and i have come across a glitch where after every cutscene or transition, my game automatically pauses? has anyone else experienced this and how to fix?
i have the same issue, i have 60mbps down and 17upload on my xbox/phone, but my PS hooked up wired is only getting me 20mbps/down and an abysmal 400kbps/upload?? not too sure on why this is

WRITING.TITLE: SLOW DOWNLOAD/UPLOAD SPEEDS
WRITING.TEXT: can someone explain to my why my ps4 won't let me have my speeds i'm getting on my phone/xbox? I have done multiple speed tests and i get average of 65mb/down and 17mb/upload on a speed test on my phone. I have both a Xbox One X, and a PS4 Slim, they are both hooked up to a router extender via a Cat 7 ethernet cable My xbox gets close to these numbers on connection tests with around 49mbps/down, and 17mbps/upload in the settings. Yet, on my PS4 with the same exact ethernet wire, only 2 feet away from my xbox, hooked up to the same extender will only get me around 20mbps/down and an ABYSMAL 400kbps/upload. Both hooked up exactly the same way yet ps4 drastically poorer connection, does anyone have the same problem with a fix? or just an answer as to why this is?
ah great! if that's true then i can live with it! was just hoping it wasn't a hardware issue! thanks for the reply!
i am in the UK, this message is aimed at US, so am i safe to presume this is a worldwide issue that extends to europe?
only joined today! glad i have an answer now though!
must of skimmed through and missed that part! cheers for the link!
i'm going to use the CX for console gaming, so is there anything in this update that will benefit me?

put that into perspective, so if you have had 7000 hours without burn in, then that means a user who uses an OLED for less that 6.5 hours a day, will have no problems with burn in for 3 years according to this info! great news! hopefully you get get upto 10,000! #128561;
hey! what do you recommend for the luminance setting? should i set this to Low or High when my main usage is Gaming??

WRITING.TITLE: LG OLED 55" CX 2 Questions about HDR/Dolby Vision, and Subtitles!!
WRITING.TEXT: Q1: just bought the LG CX 55" primarly for gaming around 2/4 hours a day, can i play HDR/Dolby Vision games in full brightness and avoid burn in? or does anyone recommend a lower number to put brightness on while im HDR/DV to prolong the OLED's life/prevent burn in? Q2: when i'm not gaming on this tele, ill be watching netflix with Subtitles, should i be worried of burn in with subtitles? i can't really watch anything without them, will i be fine with normal usage? or should i change some settings to reduce the risk of burn in (if there is any) e.g. changing colour of subtitles so they're not white? Any answers are greatly appreciated!

WRITING.TITLE: ARCTIS 7X - CHARGING QUERY
WRITING.TEXT: How do i know this thing is charging? does the power button light up as well like it says it does in the manual? the red light on the mic is flashing - i'm charging with the headset off, how will i know when to charge again while using? will the colours of the power button change to Yellow/Red? someone please explain lol
thank you for the reply!

Thank you very much for taking the time to reply! Ok great! i'm happy about the subtitles cause i have heard a few horror stories regarding that lol! Ok thanks! i will make sure to use those settings on HDR and Dolby Vision, will using those settings decrease the life span on my OLED? most of the games i play are HDR compatible, so should i reduce the OLED light to preserve the panel? or should i just not listen to the horror stories???
cheers again for the reply! my first SS headset and so i'm clueless!
Thank you for your help! cleared up a lot of anxieties! many thanks!

right! so since i've only recently changed my home xbox to his actual xbox one (so we can game share), you're saying that once i set up my XSX on Nov 10th with my account for the first time, it will set my XSX to my own home console, and so i would have to re-do the setting on my buddy's xbox one again due to XSX automatically setting itself up as my own home xbox?

cheers for the reply! yes i am aware that if i were to sign into another (currently in use) xbox one that's already been through its initial set up with another account, that a newer account added will not be set to Home Console! I was wondering if a brand new initial set up of a new (out of the box) XSX will set the first account set up (in the initial set up) will be set as the Home Console? have you had any first hand experience with this?
That's Great! thank you for taking to time to reply! it's much appreciated! however i am very jealous that you have got to play a XSX already if true lol!
absolutely return it, the price of the TV you have paid, you deserve it to be in full working order with no defects especially after 2 weeks! get an exchange! be firm and don't accept a repair!
can't wait for November 10th!!

WRITING.TITLE: XSX Quick Resume!
WRITING.TEXT: Hey Guys! I have seen a few videos on youtube/twitter regarding the Quick Resume feature. This one mainly from a Games Journalist 'Alanah Pearce' showing that after 24 hours being unplugged will still quick resume a game played a day before (even though console has been unplugged) - https://youtu.be/IcVW5QUEnLg I am presuming this XSX preview unit that Alanah is using has her power mode setting set to 'Instant On', which may explain why this feature works the way it did on the video! However, i am a user who uses the 'Power Saving' feature and so i don't reap the benefits of quick resuming a single game that XOX current has, and i will be using the same power mode (if available) on my XSX. My Question is, does anyone have any knowledge on whether this quick resume feature will work in the way this video makes out to be, on the 'Power Saving' mode? E.G. if jumping between avengers and DOOM Eternal *using quick resume* today on my XSX (in the future) with my 'Power Saving' mode enabled, then come to switch my XSX off at the end of the day. Will the Quick Resume feature work from a 'Power Saving' mode state? so when i turn on my XSX the next day (or few days later) will i be able to jump back into DOOM/Avengers from where i left off, WITHOUT using the 'Instant On' power mode? Cheers for anyone who has taken the time to read, and even bigger thanks to anyone who replies! #128513;

so this will work on the XSX regardless of which power mode i choose? would be a great thing for me! everyday i'm having to load up Avengers from start up instead of resuming where i left off which is a pain!
